threads.title: Somebody Once Told me
threads.body: That I could waste some time, by working over an hour on something. But it turned out that we didn't even need it and now I'm running low on time

replies.body: Hopefully that fixed it. If it didn't, ima be very sad :c
I can be really silly sometimes. I need to pay more attention to what I write. You know how long I spent trying to figure out what was wrong just to see that I forgot to delete a line I meant to?
Hopefully this works on the first try for a change. The form has been slightly modified.

threads.title: im very silly
threads.body: I just spent a very long time trying to figure out why users weren't being assigned to their new posts.... turned out I forgot to subscribe to my observable the entire time :c

replies.body: Buuuuut hopefully it paid off, if I'm lucky, then this reply should work the same

I forgot about our new changes to the structure of a thread internally though. Hopefully, this reply knows who it's parent is now instead of the main post being the only one to know about replies. I'm tempted to just wipe the database since none of the old posts have that field now, but i'm sort of liking how this is basically a development log now.
looks like it didn't work as intended, let's see if it does this itme around
Okay I think i fixed it for real this time haha (plz)
Okay, for REAL this tine. I promise
^ Just kidding haha, but I did fix it, and it was a truly stupid mistake. Oh well

threads.title: I think I finally got it
threads.body: This whole time I was being a doofus and forgot that searching from the server returns an array of response, so I was trying to access a property of a single object and modify it, which cause my object to malform
^ Just kidding haha, but I did fix it, and it was a truly stupid mistake. Oh well
